result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) was dismissed by the court.

  • Heather S Charnas was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Taylor County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Credit given for any administrative suspension.
Complete an AODA assessment and driver safety plan.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections. 
If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.

Provide a DNA sample or show proof of prior submission.  Pay the DNA surcharge.

Complete the AODA assessment.
Attend and successfully complete the O.W.I. Victim Impact Panel held on 01-08-2015.  Huber should be allowed for attendance.

timeConds.notes:
Conditional jail term shall begin immediately.  Good time is granted.

The defendant shall pay all sheriff and jail fees or costs allowed or imposed by law and the sheriff shall be entitled to a judgment against the defendant for any such unpaid fees or costs.

Jail can be served in any county in the State of Wisconsin provided arrangements are made by counsel or the defendant, it is approved by the Taylor County Jail, and at no additional cost to Taylor County.

Consecutive to: To Taylor County Case 14CF22.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Heather S Charnas in court with attorney Robert A. Thorson.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Agreement placed on the record by Ms. Tlusty.  DE entered a plea of no contest to Ct. 1.  Plea colloquy.  Court found plea given freely, voluntarily, and intelligently; accepted plea; found  DE guilty and ordered entry of JOC.  Pursuant to the agreement, counts 1 and 3 are dismissed and read in; Ct. 4 dismissed outright on state's motion; as well as tracking citations 14TR597 and 598 dismissed..  Arguments by counsel.  Court withheld sentence and placed DE on probation for three years with the following conditions:  payment of fine with court costs inclusive; DNA surcharge; 8 months county jail with Huber privileges and good time, consecutive to Taylor County Case 14CF22; 24 month DL revocation; $41.00 blood draw reimbursement; AODA and comply with the driver safety plan; DNA sample and surcharge; IID; Attend the OWI Victim Impact Panel.  145 days sentence credit given.
Days Credit Worksheet
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 9, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 3, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
Order for Appearance at Settlement Conference; Report to Court on Results of Settlement Conference.

Defendant Heather S Charnas in court with attorney Robert A. Thorson.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Officer Alex Zwiefelhofer, sworn and testified.  Court satisfied there is probable cause a felony occurred in Taylor County and bound DE over for trial.  Information mirroring the criminal complaint filed by the court.  Further reading of same waived; entered plea of not guilty to all charges.  Bond continued.  PTC set.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 3, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Heather S Charnas in court with attorney Robert A. Thorson by phone  Defendant Heather S Charnas in custody.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Thorson will be waiving the time limits for a preliminary hearing, but not the preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives time limits for a preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing has been scheduled for September 22, 2014 at 8:30 a.m.  Heather Charnas would like her bond amended and made a statement.   Statement by district attorney. Motion to amend bond denied.  Bond continued.     - rt
Preliminary hearing on September 22, 2014 at 08:30 am.
to Heather Sue Charnas on 08-11-2014

*Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court.  Must report to the Taylor County Sheriff's Office for Booking Procedure. Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol or controlled substances.
arrest

Kristi Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant appeared in court in custody. Court found probable cause for the arrest. Court advised DE of possible charges and penalties. Court advised DE of right to attorney.  Notice of right to attorney given to defendant.  State requested a $2000 cash bond with conditions of:  comply with booking; no possession or consumption of alcohol.  Response by Heather.  Court ordered bond with conditions as requested, plus defendant not to consume or possess any controlled substances.  Initial appearance set for 08-26-2014 at 1:00 pm.  Court ordered clerk to begin bond revocation proceedings in 14CF22.
